title: Understanding the Initial pH
text: The initial pH of the solution is given as $$10.5$$. This pH corresponds to the concentration of hydroxide ions in the solution. Use this information to find the concentration of the weak base.

title: Relating pH to pOH
text: Remember that pH and pOH are related by the equation: pH + pOH $$=$$ $$14$$. Use this to find the pOH of the solution.

title: Finding Hydroxide Ion Concentration
text: Once you have the pOH, you can find the concentration of hydroxide ions using the formula: $$[OH**-]$$ $$=$$ $${10}^{\left(-pOH\right)}$$.

title: Using the pkb Value
text: The pkb value from question c is needed to find the concentration of the weak base. Use the relationship: pkb $$=$$ $$-\ln\left(kb\right)$$ to find kb.

title: Calculating the Concentration of the Weak Base
text: Use the formula: [B] $$=$$ $${[OH**-]}^2$$ / kb to find the concentration of the weak base.
